meanings.definition: To cure or preserve (meat) by salting, smoking, or drying.
meanings.sent1: The chef precured the ham by salting it overnight.
meanings.sent2: Farmers often precure meat to make it last longer.
meanings.sent3: I precured the bacon by smoking it in my backyard.
meanings.sent4: The ancient method of precuring meat involved drying it under the sun.
meanings.sent5: Grandma's secret to delicious jerky is to precure the meat with special spices.

meanings.definition: To treat (rubber) with sulfur and heat to improve its properties.
meanings.sent1: The factory precured the rubber to make it more durable.
meanings.sent2: Shoe manufacturers often precure rubber soles for better grip.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to precure the rubber ball to bounce higher.
meanings.sent4: The process of precuring rubber involves precise temperature control.
meanings.sent5: The scientist discovered a new method to precure rubber for increased elasticity.

meanings.sent1: She precured the tickets for the concert next month.
meanings.sent2: Students should precure the necessary materials for the project in advance.
meanings.sent3: The wise traveler always precures travel essentials before the trip.
meanings.sent4: He precured the rare book before it became popular.
meanings.sent5: The team precured the equipment needed for the expedition ahead of time.
